channel.title: CyberNetSec - Regulatory
channel.description: Latest regulatory threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Conduent Data Breach: 10 Million+ Individuals' Personal & Medical Data Exposed
item.description:
Conduent Business Services, a major contractor for U.S. government agencies, has disclosed a massive data breach impacting over 10 million individuals. The incident, which occurred between October 2024 and January 2025, involved an unauthorized third party gaining access to Conduent's network and ex...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Intelligence, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: U.S. Coast Guard Poised for 'Generational Change' in Maritime Cybersecurity with $25B Funding
item.description:
The U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) is set for a 'generational change' in maritime cybersecurity, according to an analysis by the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS). Nearly $25 billion in new funding, combined with expanded regulatory authorities, will allow the USCG to comprehensively mo...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: CISA Orders Federal Agencies to Patch New Actively Exploited Vulnerability
item.description:
On October 22, 2025, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) added a new, unspecified vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. This action confirms that the flaw is being actively exploited in the wild by malicious actors. Under Binding Operational...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Regulatory

item.title: Healthcare Sector Rocked by Breaches at ModMed, LifeBridge, and Right at Home
item.description:
The healthcare sector continues to be a prime target for cyberattacks, with recent data breaches announced by Electronic Health Record (EHR) provider Modernizing Medicine (ModMed), home healthcare provider Right at Home, and Baltimore-based LifeBridge Health. The incidents, which include a ransomwar...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Regulatory

item.title: India Enacts New Telecom Cybersecurity Rules for IMEI and Mobile Number Validation
item.description:
India's Ministry of Communications has enacted new cybersecurity regulations for its telecommunications sector, effective October 22, 2025. The 'Telecommunications (Telecom Cyber Security) Amendment Rules, 2025' introduce two key measures: the establishment of a centralized Mobile Number Validation ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance, Mobile Security

item.title: UN Convention Against Cybercrime Signed in Hanoi Amid Global Endorsement and Controversy
item.description:
In a landmark event in Hanoi, Vietnam, representatives from nearly 100 UN member states have signed the United Nations Convention against Cybercrime. Adopted by the UN General Assembly in December 2024, this treaty, also known as the Hanoi Convention, establishes the first global legal framework for...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory

item.title: EU Accuses Meta and TikTok of Breaching Digital Services Act Transparency Rules
item.description:
The European Commission has issued preliminary findings that Meta's platforms (Facebook and Instagram) and TikTok have breached their obligations under the Digital Services Act (DSA). The Commission alleges the companies failed to provide adequate access to public data for researchers, hindering ind...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Lawsuit Hits SC School District After Ransomware Breach
item.description:
South Carolina's Lexington-Richland School District 5 (LR5) is facing a class-action lawsuit following a ransomware attack in June 2025 that exposed the personally identifiable information (PII) of over 31,000 students, staff, and alumni. The lawsuit alleges that the school district was negligent in...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Regulatory

item.title: NY Regulator Puts Financial Firms on Notice: You Are Accountable for Your Vendors' Security
item.description:
The New York State Department of Financial Services (DFS) has issued new guidance for financial institutions, emphasizing their ultimate accountability for managing cybersecurity risks originating from third-party service providers (TPSPs). The regulator warned that as firms increasingly rely on clo...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Healthcare Breaches Seem to Drop, But Government Shutdown Hides True Numbers
item.description:
Official data for September 2025 shows only 26 major healthcare data breaches, the lowest monthly total since 2018. However, The HIPAA Journal cautions that this apparent decline is misleading. A US government shutdown has largely halted the HHS's Office for Civil Rights (OCR) from processing and up...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance
